Package com.github.tommyettinger.cringe

Class EncryptedFileHandle

java.lang.Object
com.badlogic.gdx.files.FileHandle
com.github.tommyettinger.cringe.EncryptedFileHandle
public final class EncryptedFileHandle extends com.badlogic.gdx.files.FileHandle
A basic way to encrypt a FileHandle using the Speck Cipher. This operates by treating files as byte arrays, which this always keeps in memory as unencrypted bytes and writes to disk as encrypted bytes. All FileHandle operations are supported on at least some platforms. This can read and write Pixmap and Texture objects with encryption. You can also use writeString(String, boolean, String) and readString(String) to read and write Strings, but you must be careful to avoid version control (such as Git) changing line endings in encrypted text files. For those, using a file extension like .dat can help avoid your data being changed irreversibly.
You may want to use this class to encrypt or decrypt files on platforms that don't have the javax.crypto package, such as GWT. This is maybe technically compatible with GWT, but the libGDX Preloader generally makes using this code impossible on GWT. Text files that get encrypted will use line-ending characters as ordinary gibberish characters in the encoded output, but if a server does any filtering on line-endings, those characters will change and the encoding will break. This can be solved by setting text files to the 'b' (binary) file type in assets.txt, but there are other problems with images (and, in all likelihood, any other file types). Images are read in as binary during some of the process, but they also seem to be checked for validity and, if valid, added to a map of loaded files. The encrypted images produced here are not valid when read as PNG, JPG, or any other image format. So, sigh, GWT won't work yet. This class is marked as GwtIncompatible, which affects the GWT compiler so that it ignores this class there.
This uses 34 long items as its full key, and additionally generates one long nonce from the key and some unique String, such as the relative path of the given FileHandle. Don't expect much meaningful security out of this, but this is enough to prevent the average user from just opening up a JAR to look at all the images or read the whole script. Someone determined enough could use a Java agent to replace the writing part of this class with part that writes files unencrypted, or just browse the unencrypted data in-memory, so this is very far from bulletproof.
Based off a gist by MobiDevelop.

  • Constructor Details

    • EncryptedFileHandle

      public EncryptedFileHandle(com.badlogic.gdx.files.FileHandle file, long k1, long k2, long k3, long k4)
      Creates a EncryptedFileHandle that can write encrypted data to the wrapped FileHandle or read and decrypt encrypted data from the wrapped FileHandle. The four-part key and the FileHandle's FileHandle.path() must all be the same between encryption and decryption for them to refer to the same unencrypted file. This overload is meant to be used when the path will be the same for reading and writing. If the path may be different, use EncryptedFileHandle(FileHandle, long, long, long, long, CharSequence) with either only the first path or some other source of a unique String.
      Parameters:
      file - the FileHandle to wrap; may be any type, such as Files.FileType.Internal
      k1 - part 1 of the key; may be any long
      k2 - part 2 of the key; may be any long
      k3 - part 3 of the key; may be any long
      k4 - part 4 of the key; may be any long

    • EncryptedFileHandle

      public EncryptedFileHandle(com.badlogic.gdx.files.FileHandle file, long[] keyBundle)
      Creates a EncryptedFileHandle that can write encrypted data to the wrapped FileHandle or read and decrypt encrypted data from the wrapped FileHandle. The long array keyBundle and the FileHandle's FileHandle.path() must all be the same between encryption and decryption for them to refer to the same unencrypted file. This overload is meant to be used when the path will be the same for reading and writing. If the path may be different, use EncryptedFileHandle(FileHandle, long[], CharSequence) with either only the first path or some other source of a unique String.
      Parameters:
      file - the FileHandle to wrap; may be any type, such as Files.FileType.Internal
      keyBundle - a long array that should be at least length 34; if not, the remaining items are generated

    • EncryptedFileHandle

      public EncryptedFileHandle(com.badlogic.gdx.files.FileHandle file, CharSequence keyphrase)
      Creates a EncryptedFileHandle that can write encrypted data to the wrapped FileHandle or read and decrypt encrypted data from the wrapped FileHandle. The String or other CharSequence keyphrase and the FileHandle's FileHandle.path() must all be the same between encryption and decryption for them to refer to the same unencrypted file. This overload is meant to be used when the path will be the same for reading and writing. If the path may be different, use EncryptedFileHandle(FileHandle, CharSequence, CharSequence) with either only the first path or some other source of a unique String.
      Parameters:
      file - the FileHandle to wrap; may be any type, such as Files.FileType.Internal
      keyphrase - a typically-sentence-to-paragraph-length CharSequence, such as a String, that will be used to generate keys

    • EncryptedFileHandle

      public EncryptedFileHandle(com.badlogic.gdx.files.FileHandle file, CharSequence keyphrase, CharSequence unique)
      Creates a EncryptedFileHandle that can write encrypted data to the wrapped FileHandle or read and decrypt encrypted data from the wrapped FileHandle. The keyphrase and the unique String must all be the same between encryption and decryption for them to refer to the same unencrypted file. This overload is meant to be used when reading and writing to different paths; the unique String should be generated from only one of the paths, if you generate it from a path at all.
      Parameters:
      file - the FileHandle to wrap; may be any type, such as Files.FileType.Internal
      keyphrase - a typically-sentence-to-paragraph-length CharSequence, such as a String, that will be used to generate keys
      unique - any CharSequence that is likely to be unique for a given key, such as the path to the wrapped file

    • EncryptedFileHandle

      public EncryptedFileHandle(com.badlogic.gdx.files.FileHandle file, long[] keyBundle, CharSequence unique)
      Creates a EncryptedFileHandle that can write encrypted data to the wrapped FileHandle or read and decrypt encrypted data from the wrapped FileHandle. The four-part key and the unique String must all be the same between encryption and decryption for them to refer to the same unencrypted file. This overload is meant to be used when reading and writing to different paths; the unique String should be generated from only one of the paths, if you generate it from a path at all.
      Parameters:
      file - the FileHandle to wrap; may be any type, such as Files.FileType.Internal
      keyBundle - a long array that should be at least length 34; if not, the remaining items are generated
      unique - any String that is likely to be unique for a given key, such as the path to the wrapped file

    • EncryptedFileHandle

      public EncryptedFileHandle(com.badlogic.gdx.files.FileHandle file, long k1, long k2, long k3, long k4, CharSequence unique)
      Creates a EncryptedFileHandle that can write encrypted data to the wrapped FileHandle or read and decrypt encrypted data from the wrapped FileHandle. The four-part key and the unique String must all be the same between encryption and decryption for them to refer to the same unencrypted file. This overload is meant to be used when reading and writing to different paths; the unique String should be generated from only one of the paths, if you generate it from a path at all.
      Parameters:
      file - the FileHandle to wrap; may be any type, such as Files.FileType.Internal
      k1 - part 1 of the key; may be any long
      k2 - part 2 of the key; may be any long
      k3 - part 3 of the key; may be any long
      k4 - part 4 of the key; may be any long
      unique - any String that is likely to be unique for a given key, such as the path to the wrapped file
